website_summaries.verdict: An effective device that will do its job quietly.
pros: Built-in cruise control feature minimizes power usage yet lends to consistent cleaning
Can move rocks and with minimal noise
cons: The battery life may lose its charge quickly in some scenarios

customer_reviews.title: Wife happy with her new tools.
customer_reviews.text: Got this, two batteries, and the mower for my 4' 10" wife, replacing a self-propelled, gas mower and a corded, hand-held blower. She says her life is vastly improved. Even not self-propelled, the lightness makes the mowing easier. For the blower, lack of dropcords saves tons of time. Both products run 20-30 minutes on a charge. Charges are quick. Quality seems good, though not professional grade. Very impressive. Thinking about adding the hedge clippers and pole saw to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: Update:(7/20/2018) Fan that sucks air got loose and now the blower is useless. I have to open the green mesh to get to it to fix it. Only used it for 3 months now and maybe once a week. Very disapoointed about the durability the product.. I will contact Greenworks to see if I can get a replacement one... exceeds my expectation. No shortage of blowing power and running time. I have 4 ap battery. Used 2 lights out of 3(battery remaining indicator) after 2hrs of blowing!
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: I liked when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that after less than a year that I bought it, is not working. I think I've used three times last summer, I liked when it worked, but this year, getting ready for spring I started the damned machine and nothing, just starts for a microsecond and pufff. Nothing!!!! So disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, very ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack blower... I previously owned a handheld unit, which after a short time the weight and vibration would make my hand sore. This unit sits comfortably on my back and is so light that I can hardly tell it's there. The professional style blower wand and variable speed control makes this very easy to use. Assembly of the hose section did require more than two hands to connect the sections... But, I'm extremely satisfied with this product...
customer_reviews.author: 808 heath

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I placed 1 order complete with battery, charger and Backpack, returned it then ordered just the backpack and charger, since I already had a new battery. Neither purchase worked at all the charger did not charge the battery right.. Very disatisfied as I got it for a gift for my husband. Greenworks cant seem to perfect the charger and battery issues. They do have good product support but a defect is a DEFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Melee

customer_reviews.title: Battery hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: If it weren't for the poor battery enclosure design, I'd give this a 5 star. see attached picture that shows one can only grasp very large battery with the tips of one's fingers. instructions state: "It may require a strong pull to remove it." I have to wait for my husband to get home to remove the battery, or ask a neighbor. even then, the neighbor found it very hard to remove. Not idea when I only get to use blower for 30 minutes. other than that, I love how light weight it is, and the long nozzle with arm control.
customer_reviews.author: Medicine Woman

customer_reviews.title: My husband adores this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this as my husband's birthday gift because he is crazy over it. I suspect he looks for reasons to use it. I've also used it and can understand why he is so bonkers for it. The backpack is SO COMFORTABLE, the noise level is far lower than our old cordless - much less a gas-powered blower, and it doesn't tire my arm in the least. It blows dried leaves with ease. Damp grass requires the "turbo" button but it succumbs too. The battery life is pretty good and the charger is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: SnowKnitty

customer_reviews.title: Light, quiet and not too powerful
customer_reviews.text: Positive attributes: Light, super easy start (just push the trigger), not too noisy at all. Negative attributes: Short battery life (about 15 minutes), not very powerful. I doubt it will be able to blow wet leaves. However, it is great for blowing pine neddles and pine cones from driveway. Fall is coming very soon, if this blower will not blow leaves from my lawn, I will have to buy a gas powered leave blower, which after a lot of research, I narrowed down to either Husqvarna (#1), or Stihl (#2).
customer_reviews.author: Flying Cat

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, but battery is only good for about 20-25 mins
customer_reviews.text: Love this leaf blower although not the battery. The blower is comparatively very light. The straps are comfortable and can be adjusted to get a nice, snug feel. The noise level is very tolerable even for the person operating it (and a fraction of gas blowers’ noise). I like the three speeds: you can adjust without turning the blower off. Battery life is the only issue. You’ll get about 20-25 minutes. So if you have a huge leafy space to clear, one charge will not work. Otherwise; it’s a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rumata2003

customer_reviews.title: Green!
customer_reviews.text: Light and Strong. I ended up buying a few other greenworks products to get the bang for my buck on the battery cost. I like not having to worry about gas/oil mixtures, spark plugs, flooded engines, etc. The 80V line is definitely the right amount of power for a 1 acre lot.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: All Good, Mostly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blower and so much easier to use than a gas model. It's so easy to grab and go I'm cleaning up much more often and sing for both small and large jobs. Assembly was a bit difficult; instructions were vague. I finally got the first section of the blower tube attached by opening the clamp completely, that is I removed the screw altogether, attached the tube then opened the clamp and slipped over the assembly then replaced the screw. The battery was difficult to remove until I found the advice to press very firmly on the release latch. Dead easy thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: oreddie

customer_reviews.title: Battery Broke - no electricity to charge - shorted it out after 5 months and only 12 uses
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, plugged in the battery just 4 months after purchase - used only a dozen times since Nov. I live in the Northeast so winter just ending. I have repeatedly tried to contact Greenworks by phone - call is never answered and now 100% busy line. I have emailed them 4 times and no response. This unit is still under warranty and yet I can't get anyone at the Manufacturer to handle this. I'll try mailing them but so far completely frustrated and a big Expense down the Drain!!!!! VERY UNHAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BLOWER!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this blower! It has good power, it's so simple, safe and hassle-free to use. Way!!! better than dealing with my smoking, polluting, maintenance nightmare gas 2-cycle engine backpack blowers. I am using this for my commercial lawn treatment business and I will be getting one of them for all my technicians. If your a homeowner this machine will last you forever. Remember to store the battery at home temperature over the winter and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful motor
customer_reviews.text: Super powerful motor. Clears the road in record time, even the wet leaves go flying. The only downside is the battery doesn't last very long between charges. Recommend have a couple spare cells handy for any large projects. It is a Great Machine. The kids think it's Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Leonard

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Have used the leaf blower 3 times so far, pleased with the results. It lives up to the claim that it will run about 35 minutes on standard speed (maybe a little longer?). I run it mostly on standard with some turbo mixed in. Also takes about 35-40 minutes to recharge, as advertised. So I do some leaf blowing, come in and have lunch while it recharges, then go back out again. Will likely get a 2nd battery so won't have to wait. Has no trouble moving heavy oak and chestnut leaves, (some of the leaves were wet). Like that it is much quieter than a gas backpack blower and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lawn business. I’ve been thinking about getting a handheld blower for some time. This has a surprising amount of power. It is heavy though. I tried it on my smallest property last month. Not many leaves to clean. I wanted to test it’s run time. It lasted about 22-25 minutes. I used the turbo button more than half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. It’s a little combersom getting the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. It’s a little combersom getting the blower on your back. I just wish I could switch batteries without taking this thing off my back. I find the mounting of the on/off switch a little awkward if you’re a teller person. All in all, I find this blower to be quite capable when coupled with a 5.0 Ah battery. Any lower rated battery requires frequent swapping out.
customer_reviews.author: UM

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I just tried this after charging the battery. It is lightweight, quiet, and it blew the chicken's poop off of my porch. It took the cobwebs off of my house, this thing is freaking amazing!!! I can't wait for the rain to be over, so I can just go crazy cleaning everything outside. Fantastic product, and if you're a 50+ woman like me, it's really easy to tote, I do it on one shoulder. The only issue, is that I'm left handed, and this is for right handers, but I'll adapt.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Ann Letostak

customer_reviews.title: Battery may be an issue
customer_reviews.text: The battery for my blower was defective when shipped. Greenworks Tools is shipping a replacement but it will take 7 to 10 days to get it. They do not do expedited shipping. That is a long time to wait to clean up my leafs at the end of November. The power of this unit is awesome, however, the battery charge life is only 20 to 30 minutes, not enough time to get much done. You will need at least two batteries for anything larger than small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: td in lp

customer_reviews.title: Good Product with limitations
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts about 30 min on turbo. Recharged in 35. The company wants to sell you a backup battery that almost costs as much as the blower. Not good can see through their strategy. Poor. If you only need the product for 1/2 hour of work, good product. Also the battery release clip/design is poorly designed. Sounds like you are going to break the clip each time you have to get the battery out for charging. And after you do SNAP the clip, your next chore is removing the battery from the charging station. Again, not good. Blower is powerful and works well. Your call considering my posted limitations.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant about buying a battery powered unit. I am glad I did. Works great, lite weight. Only minor issue is that the charger signals a hot charger while charging. I constantly feel the need to check it. I also purchased the weed eater, like it as well, there isn't an issue with that charger. NO MORE GAS/OIL MIXING Update: we have used several times, my wife really likes them, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Allen H

customer_reviews.title: I have all 80v Greenworks tools so I have enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I have all 80v Greenworks tools so I have enough batteries and chargers to keep this going through the day, ideally three 2ah batteries with three chargers will keep you in business for constant operation. Very quiet operation compared to a similar powered gas blower. I have a Stihl blower which has been gathering dust since I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Anydaynow

customer_reviews.title: Love Greenworks Products
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old gas blower. Works great. Driveway is 350 feet of blacktop and the 80V handles the garage, driveway and both decks with one charge. If I utilize the turbo feature it handles about 75% of the job, however, as I have other 80V Greeworks products, I just pop in the other battery and complete the mission. Well worth purchasing. No more gas and oil mixtures to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Backpack good - battery and customer service poor
customer_reviews.text: The backpack blower itself is just fine. Both the battery and customer service at Green Works are horrible. Here’s what I wrote about the battery: ” I really expected a battery that lasts more than 18 months. I bought this in November 2018 and its 2nd died about a year and a half later. Worked fine one day and just quit the next. Item was not damaged I think it’s very flawed battery. After three attempts to contact Green Works I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Greenworks cordless backpack blower met all my expectations. It was easy to put together out of the box. Charged the battery. Was ready to go to work. The power of the blower was more than adequate for the work I needed to perform. However, I do want to note that this unit was not as powerful as the neighbor's Stihl gas-powered backpack blower. I am quite satisfied though with its performance. It is simple to operate and have had my daughter and son use it on small tasks outdoors without having to fuss with how to start it, fill up with fuel, etc. Good unit for most weekend warriors tackling home jobs.
customer_reviews.author: John Hanlon

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, convenient, and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love that it has multiple speeds - you can blow lightly or give it everything it's got (which is quite a bit). Others have not positively reviewed the "cruise control" switch, but I love it. It's so convenient to set a constant speed and only squeeze the trigger when you need a little bit more juice. It also allows you to loosen your grip a little and reduce arm fatigue. Battery life is no concern - with the 80v battery this could go all day.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Anglea

customer_reviews.title: Great electric blower
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not as powerful as gas blowers I own, but works pretty good. First week was disappointed that battery died after just 20 minutes use (on high) until I realized that with electric blowers, better to use lower speeds and it worked for large property. Still would get two batteries for larger jobs. Sound is significantly quiter than gas blower and is lighter and easier to start.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: It pretty much blows
customer_reviews.text: This blower is...well...got me on the fence. It's light, it's relatively quiet (for a blower), but thank goodness for the turbo button. Without it I don't know how much I'd really like it. The battery life on turbo is abysmal, but it gets the job done for a small area....but barely. I wouldn't recommend this for big jobs unless you have a lot of large batteries on hand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vallier

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: This blower works great. I have not had to sweep or rake anything I was trying to blow on my driveway, lawn, or street. It's pretty much the same as corded units I've used in the past. It's quiet but I think it's a little heavy (10#) so after awhile I have to switch hands, but it's still easier to deal with than dragging a cord behind me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: This blower is effortless!
customer_reviews.text: I use this blower for both light and heavy tasks. It is not quite as strong as my gas powered blower, but it is so much easier to use and has plenty of power for most jobs. I love the turbo feature. Brings its blowing power more in line with gas powered version. I bought this to blow out the deck of my lawn tractor but use it for many of my blowing needs. It is lightweight and easy to use - much easier than my gas powered blower.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Clamp does not hold tube in place. The tube ...
customer_reviews.text: Clamp does not hold tube in place. The tube will constantly fall apart while operating. Also low power output. Very expensive for these problems.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with this backpack blower. It works better than I expected, blows leaves as good or better than my Echo gas backpack. And there is no mixing gas and oil and pulling on a starter rope to get it started. For nearly constant full power blowing battery lasts about 30 minutes and takes about 35 minutes to recharge. At my age I'm usually ready for a break after 30 minutes anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Case

customer_reviews.title: So easy to ise
customer_reviews.text: This I my brother try A battery operated blower never thought it would be as good as it is 145 mph is just great how many 3 acres very manageable and lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Moms T

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: The performance of this blower lived up to the positive reviews, Though less effective than gasoline- powered backpacks, it did a credible job with a lot less weight and more convenience. But when it came time to recharge the battery, I was not able to eject it easily. Consulting the manual, I found the caution that "the battery may require a strong pull to remove it" an understatement. Having strong hands, I finally pulled the battery out; but the blower will not be usable for persons with less strength, especially strength of grip. This deficiency could be substantially addressed by a handle on the end of the battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Roby

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I confess I haven't had the chance to put it through the full testing yet, but so far it has been awesome. The ease of use is so worth the price. And now I can easily go get the leaves that blew into my neighbors' yards while I waited for more to fall off the trees! If you've ever strung 2 long extension cords together, then this is the blower for you. Added bonus: far less noise so easier on the ears.
customer_reviews.author: D Mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: So far (a month) I found it to be powerful enough for all my blowing needs. It is so convenient to have it ready at all time. Just grab it off the shelf and turn the lever and it goes. No fuel to mix and worry about starting or dragging an extension cord. It blows debris, water puddles, dry and wet leaves. Recharges very quickly (40 minutes or so)
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I got the 80V and it is great! easy to set up, easy to use, very light and lasts awhile. I did notice that it is not quite as powerful as a gas, but considering it’s fully electric, it holds its own very well. definitely has decent speed and power. I have already recommended to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C

customer_reviews.title: Great Blower for most
customer_reviews.text: I moved to all battery operated GreenWorks products. Happy with all of them - including this backpack blower. Did buy a second battery as I have a large property and one battery wouldn't quite get the job done. Otherwise, it is powerful, easy to operate, and much lighter than my gas powered backpack this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Kills battery faster than mower, but works
customer_reviews.text: Better than the hand held version by far. However, kills the battery about twice as fast as our GW mower. I can leaf blow back half of our .8 lot before it needs recharging.. other than that- it works. Is it amazing? No. But it’s quieter than gas and pushes leaves faster than my rake.
customer_reviews.author: Lakkiada

customer_reviews.title: Great power- even if battery drains faster than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blower for the smaller yard we have! It gets the job down well with battery to spare, but I am surprised the battery doesn't last longer, all things considered. Nonetheless, love the blower lock for speed and the turbo feature. Overall, it's a great blower!
customer_reviews.author: vh

customer_reviews.title: Better than 12v plug in
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this leaf blower, a weed eater and lawn mower. They have worked better than expected. The battery life is sufficient for a small yard and they all have more than enough power. This leaf blower has more power than any 12v plug in I have ever used and is just marginally heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: It works great:)
customer_reviews.text: I just love it and the turbo button , huge coverage ,blows the leaves of my mulch leaving the mulch and with turbo it can blow out the mulch too fun . easy as slipping in the battery I'm very happy. plus its just not that loud , I wish landscapers at other homes had to use electric !!!
customer_reviews.author: John Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Battery duration a real problem.
customer_reviews.text: Battery pack does not work for more than 10 to 15 minutes depending on throttle. Very disappointed. Battery technology is so far ahead of what this battery back produces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this product. The battery that comes with it is decent, but if you want to work continuously blowing leaves before you bag them, buy the second, longer lasting battery. I start with the smaller battery, when it runs out, I put it on the charger and switch to the larger one. Before the larger one runs out, the first battery is ready to go. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A Mader

customer_reviews.title: Quality for price
customer_reviews.text: This works great, super light weight, last close to just under an hour running full speed
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Palmer

customer_reviews.title: A short battery life and not as much power as expected
customer_reviews.text: Like the backpack. Blower not as strong as our corded electric model. Definitely need a second battery. Also had difficulty getting battery to make a good connection. Had to stop often and re-insert the battery. WE ARE RETURNING.
customer_reviews.author: SSB

customer_reviews.title: Beats using fossil fuels and it’s very powerful - jealous neighbors
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the hubby for Father’s Day and he’s all pumped up. He loves this and his matching lawn mower. And the next door neighbor guy was super jealous and asked a ton of questions. hahahahahaha Down with evil fossil fuels!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product/ poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Whats nice is that it pulls air from 360° around. So the blower doesn't pull in a particular direction. Very light, until you put the battery in. Has a speed lock lever which alleviates stiff trigger finger. Has a turbo button which is ok. It could have been eliminated and they could have just made the top speed higher. Customer assistance is non existent. Im still waiting for an email reply from March 2020 and when I call its easily an hour wait the 2x I called and no one picked up and I couldn't wait any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All the power you need
customer_reviews.text: I was very reluctant to buy a battery powered blower, but I’m very happy with this product. I did buy the 80 V 4 amp. I think that makes a difference. Regardless, I am super happy with the product and it is just as powerful as any of the gas powered leaf blower’s I’ve had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: There are definite pluses to this leaf blower verses a gas powered blower. It is lighter, quieter and doesn’t smell. It is easy to use. If you have a small yard this would work great. I am sad to say that it doesn’t have the power that my other blower has so it is more work to use. I do use both blowers, it just depends on the job which one I use. The Greenworks blower tends to be for quick jobs as the battery only lasts about a half hour. I have most of the Greenworks tools. This is the first one that I was disappointed in.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Rolfe

customer_reviews.title: Missing screw
customer_reviews.text: Missing screw that holds control on to blower tube. Customer service at Greenworks couldn't figure out what I was talking about. Said they would follow up, it's been more than a month and haven't heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy A

customer_reviews.title: Great product, need second battery to make useful.
customer_reviews.text: Great volume of air, rivals commercial gas powered backpack blowers. Real world battery life with 2.5AH battery is about 35min and charge time a little over an hour. It make it difficult to complete the job but with a larger second battery will be a great unit. Would buy again but wish the battery life was better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY LIFE!!
customer_reviews.text: Power is perfectly fine, but stock battery life (2.5a) is completely inadequate unless you have a small yard. Recharging tales a LONG TIME I'm returning and going with the ryobi which can accept two batteries at once
customer_reviews.author: artesanal salt inc.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet, stylish, powerful, lasts a long time, and with the 4amp hour battery, its still light in my opinion. But most importantly, I don't have to mess with gas anymore and its maintenance issues. Just pop the battery in and go. I also love that I can use the same battery for all the greenworks projects.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not a Bad Blower
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, my battery charged very fast, I had a Full charge in about 20 minutes. Battery was down only 2 out of 3 power indicator lights after doing 2 medium lots, 75' X 200'.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.E. 😜

customer_reviews.title: does not suck......it blows
customer_reviews.text: It has enough power to blow the leaves. The backpack is a little on the small side.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The battery is impossible to remove. Green works should be ashamed to sell this item. The machine blows but trying to remove battery for charging is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis A. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Great blower
customer_reviews.text: I really like this blower! It replaced my older electric model blower. The extension cords drove me crazy. This blower is lightweight, easy to maneuver, and has a powerful punch. It even worked well on wet leaves. We have a large yard so the battery last about 25 mins. I do recommend two batteries if you have a larger yard. I don’t think you’ll be disappointed with this blower.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The product has worked well for 1.5 years. I've probably used it for ~10 hours total during this time and it stopped working - it appears that the battery will not charge. I filled out their customer service form with all product serial number on June 16 and followed up a week later. I understand that these are unusual times, but 5 weeks to respond to a concern is a bit much. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: momof_two

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This a great for blowing leaves. However, the battery only last for about a half an hour of continuous use. A back up battery in necessary if have nice size yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jcool_ace

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and so quick. We already had the battery and charger for the other equipment we have. Worked well. I can see using this for quick cleanup and using the gas powered one for big jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Advance Kimballs

customer_reviews.title: Good Power, Short Runtime.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to make the move from a Gas to a Battery Powered system. Overall it seems to have good power and the variable speed is great. The biggest thing that i was dissappointed by was the run time. I was expecting 30 - 40 minutes, as it is not used on full power the whole time. but it seemed to die out within ~20 minutes
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: 80v blower is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Stop your search. This is the one blows leaves through the grass like a hot knife through butter. 1 con is that it can get heavy after 20min
customer_reviews.author: AWK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing "when the trigger works"
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 1 month and 3 days, I used it like 5 times and loved it. But now the trigger is starting to not work. I have to squeeze it like 4-5 times and maybe one of them will actually start it.. funny its just barely outside the return window and the seller won't respond.....
customer_reviews.author: Amanda decker

customer_reviews.title: Full Disclosure ???
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit discouraged to discover the extra large charge for the battery and charger. I did not expect the high cost and it made to workable blower very expensive. Had I been more careful at reading all the fine print, I probably would not have chosen this blower. Works well, but felt the full cost should have been disclosed more.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blower but less flexible.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds good to be able to put on back. But is is stiffer and less flexible and not as powerful as the hand healed one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wu

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Blower is great. Works as good as my neighbor's gas powered backpack blower but at about 1/4 the weight. The only downside is that on turbo I only get about 15 minutes run time. For daily cleanup of leaves & acorns on the deck & patio this is a great tool. If you need more run time then another battery would be in order.
customer_reviews.author: Us

customer_reviews.title: So far a great product but get 2 batteries
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to use and easy to set up out of the box. Buy an extra battery though as it runs about 30 minutes. I have a large yard so i needed both batteries to complete it for max cleanup
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, medium light weight
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy, I’m 5’4” and can maneuver pretty well. It’s fall, I use it almost weekly to blow off my driveway and patio.
customer_reviews.author: shanika80

customer_reviews.title: High power. Battery needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a battery-powered leaf blower, and this delivered in terms of power... but the battery didn’t last long and the machine shorted out constantly, even on my first use. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan D. Wilber

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this blower for about 4 months, and it's already only working intermittently.
customer_reviews.author: Big Gnarly Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lightweight powerful Blower
customer_reviews.text: This machine is fantastic, light weight with a lot of power. The video will show me blowing sticks and limbs across my back yard after a tornado blew through.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Tolleson

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows! (In a good way)
customer_reviews.text: Has some serious power and great battery life. The backpack design makes it very easy to maneuver. Only down side is that it takes up quite a bit of room in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: J-Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good unit except for battery
customer_reviews.text: Only disappointment is the battery which lasts 20 to 25 minutes at best. A 2nd battery is a must to be good effective.
customer_reviews.author: KenH

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Very poor product, no available spare parts or after sales service. They do not reply to emails.
customer_reviews.author: lowlaw

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I used to landscape when I was young. This product does not compete with the industrial products, however it works for what I need to do at home and works well. No gas burned.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Guide

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this blower
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this blower. Even if I can't complete the job in one charge, re-charging takes only about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Reddersen

customer_reviews.title: MUCH quieter than my gas powered Weedeater
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of power to blow debris. Relatively short battery run time made up for by 30 minute recharge time. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: T&S

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull
customer_reviews.text: Perfect xmas gift for my son. Says it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Pammy

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I very happy with my new blower. Going cordless was my best move.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Dreiman

customer_reviews.title: great blower
customer_reviews.text: i love it does the job is the same has the gasoline blower i have solar power so i can charge for free.
customer_reviews.author: john angelosanto

customer_reviews.title: Has a good amount of air output
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight, and easy to use. The controls are simple and easy to operate. But expect the battery to last only about 20 minutes. So plan on having at least one, if not two spare batteries ready to go for a big job.
customer_reviews.author: Bighorn

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A FULL SET OF GREENWORKS PRODUCTS USED THEM CONTINUOSELY ..THIS BLOWER IS AWESOME ...HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT..
customer_reviews.author: John Finney

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this leaf blower, however, battery life is too short. Also, my product came with one screw missing. I called the manufacturer and the only way to get the product with the missing screw was to send the whole thing back. I ended up going to a hardware store for the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks always nails it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on a small lot, but does go through batteries fast. Great for cleaning sidewalk and garage. Great for cleaning all spiderwebs hanging in garage.
customer_reviews.author: hsmith

customer_reviews.title: Good powerful blower, lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Product is lightweight and powerful. So much easier to use than handheld gas blower.Got rid of gas blower after using this item.
customer_reviews.author: Castoneturner E. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product ....
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pro level product that has plenty of power the blow just about anything around ...
customer_reviews.author: Deryl Houser

customer_reviews.title: almost as powerful as a gas backpack blower
customer_reviews.text: This is great & light & doesn't reek of gas. Powerful blower.
customer_reviews.author: ETS

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is perfect but this is close. Does a great job on my small yard which was what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great product. No gas, no electricity needed either. Love the easy yard cleanup! Totally worth purchasing this little but powerful machine.
customer_reviews.author: mf.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, battery quit working, no replay to email
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product I won’t deny that. My battery stopped working after handful if charges and I received no reply to an email over warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband as Christmas gift and he loves that he doesn’t have to carry the awkward, heavy blower anymore. This also has a lot more power!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blower
customer_reviews.text: As good if not better than a gasoline blower without an internal combustion engine strapped to your back.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed something extremely lightweight but powerful to move Connecticut leaves! The battery lasts about 30 - 40 min depending on how hard it is being worked. If you can trade off weight for battery life, I'd recommend the longer-lasting but somewhat heavier battery.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Very powerful. Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Easy to use. Very powerful. Quiet. On full power, battery lasts around 30 minutes, then recharges in 30 minutes. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: david-in-harmony

customer_reviews.title: Small Backpack, Big Impact!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that it's not as powerful as a gas powered, but this little thing packs a punch. We got it to clear dust and leaves from our loading dock area and HOLY COW! We are able to use it to clear away small stones too. Definitely a great product at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to wear, battery life was only 20 mins
customer_reviews.text: Battery life lasted about 20 mins, for a small job this would be great but we have a large yard so I need something that last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One sweet blower
customer_reviews.text: It is light and powerful. Takes me about 2 minutes to blow off the patio, walks and drive. Used to take 10 with a broom.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gustin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blower, but it's been great. Weight is good, power is good.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: awesome..
customer_reviews.text: love it lots of power and its small and very very light weight..awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
